item.title: [Matrix] Adding New Woodcutting Emotes

item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“mrx dodian, post:6, topic:463655”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=567235.msg4122242#msg4122242 date=1349892354]

It’s new because matrix uses the another one hence new dumbass.

It’s not new dumbass. Just because Matrix uses the other animation doesn’t mean it’s new. It means Matrix is outdated.
[/quote]

It’s Newer than the other one you Idiot. And its NOT the lumberjack emote, what the hell are you going on about.[/quote]

RuneScape doesn’t even use that animation unless it was for a quest.

@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

item.title: [Matrix] Adding New Woodcutting Emotes
item.dc:creator: @mrx_dodian mrx dodian
item.description:
@mrx_dodian wrote:

First tutorial, Thought it might come in handy for some.
Preview: (LOOKS ALOT CLEANER IN GAME THEN NORMAL)

New: Old:

First off open Woodcutting.java
Search for

case 6739

You should find

case 6739: // dragon axe if (level >= 61) { emoteId = 2846; axeTime = 13; return true; } break; case 1359: // rune axe if (level >= 41) { emoteId = 867; axeTime = 10; return true; } break; case 1357: // adam axe if (level >= 31) { emoteId = 869; axeTime = 7; return true; } break; case 1355: // mit axe if (level >= 21) { emoteId = 871; axeTime = 5; return true; } break; case 1361: // black axe if (level >= 11) { emoteId = 873; axeTime = 4; return true; } break; case 1353: // steel axe if (level >= 6) { emoteId = 875; axeTime = 3; return true; } break; case 1349: // iron axe emoteId = 877; axeTime = 2; return true; case 1351: // bronze axe emoteId = 879; axeTime = 1; return true; case 13661: // Inferno adze if (level >= 61) { emoteId = 10251; axeTime = 13; return true;
Replace that with

case 6739: // dragon axe if (level >= 61) { emoteId = 12336; axeTime = 13; return true; } break; case 1359: // rune axe if (level >= 41) { emoteId = 12335; axeTime = 10; return true; } break; case 1357: // adam axe if (level >= 31) { emoteId = 12334; axeTime = 7; return true; } break; case 1355: // mit axe if (level >= 21) { emoteId = 12333; axeTime = 5; return true; } break; case 1361: // black axe if (level >= 11) { emoteId = 12332; axeTime = 4; return true; } break; case 1353: // steel axe if (level >= 6) { emoteId = 12331; axeTime = 3; return true; } break; case 1349: // iron axe emoteId = 12330; axeTime = 2; return true; case 1351: // bronze axe emoteId = 12329; axeTime = 1; return true; case 13661: // Inferno adze if (level >= 61) { emoteId = 12336; axeTime = 13; return true;

-Compile

Done.

Read full topic
